description: A Warmthkeeper Emberling is a small, fire-based elemental often found in the hearths of kind-hearted folk or within the enchanted woods where the air is always warm. They emit a soft, comforting heat and are known to protect those who are lost in cold environments. With flickering flames for hair and a body resembling smoldering coals, these creatures are beloved for their ability to keep travelers warm and safe during cold nights.
damage_resistances: Fire; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
languages: Ignan, understands Common but cannot speak
lair_type: Warm environments, especially near sources of heat such as campfires or hearths

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that touches the Emberling or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1d6 fire damage.

traits.name: Illuminating Glow
traits.description: The Emberling sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

actions.name: Ember Burst
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 2d6 fire damage.

actions.name: Warm Embrace
actions.description: The Emberling wraps its fiery arms around a willing creature, granting it resistance to cold damage for 1 hour. The Emberling can only grant this benefit to one creature at a time.
